objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the primary author and publisher of this report, providing analysis and recommendations regarding the DAMASCENED PEACOCK malware.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK C2 domain
objects.description: Command and control (C2) domain used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK for beaconing and payload retrieval.

objects.name: Malware delivery domain
objects.description: Domain used to deliver the DAMASCENED PEACOCK payload in the infection chain.

objects.name: Malware delivery URL
objects.description: URL used to serve the DAMASCENED PEACOCK malware as part of the spear-phishing campaign.

objects.name: Downloaded 3rd stage payload
objects.description: Path where DAMASCENED PEACOCK writes the downloaded third stage payload DLL before loading it via COM hijack.

objects.name: COM Hijack registry key
objects.description: Registry key hijacked by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to achieve persistence and execute the downloaded payload within explorer.exe.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first stage) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the first stage downloader executable used to initiate the infection chain.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first stage) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the first stage downloader executable used to initiate the infection chain.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first stage) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the first stage downloader executable used to initiate the infection chain.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload.

objects.name: Indicator for DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL (XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows, delivered via spear-phishing. It is implemented as a 32-bit DLL with a single export named DllExport containing the malicious functionality. The malware is responsible for downloading the final stage and executing it via a COM Hijack. It uses defence evasion techniques such as XOR based string obfuscation and dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is proxy aware and communicates with its C2 server over HTTP, on port 8080, and is configured to beacon to the domain apimonger[.]com. It is a variant of RustyClaw and SnipBot, and part of the wider RomCom malware family.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: RustyClaw is a malware variant documented by Talos and is part of the RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant of RustyClaw, now split over two stages.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: SnipBot is a malware variant documented by Palo Alto Networks and is part of the RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant of SnipBot, now split over two stages.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: RomCom is a malware family that includes variants such as RustyClaw, SnipBot, and DAMASCENED PEACOCK. These malware samples share similar infection chains and techniques.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: DustyHammock is referenced as the final stage in the infection chain following DAMASCENED PEACOCK. DAMASCENED PEACOCK acts as a stage between RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: MOD
objects.description: The UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) detected the spear-phishing campaign targeting staff and contributed information to the analysis of DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: FUTURICO LLC is the organisation whose code signing certificate was used to sign the first stage downloader in the DAMASCENED PEACOCK infection chain.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Talos is referenced as an industry source that previously documented RustyClaw, a variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks
objects.description: Palo Alto Networks is referenced as an industry source that previously documented SnipBot, a variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with Dynamic Resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
